comments: a(n) is the smallest number m such that pi(m)=d(m)^n, where d(m) is number of positive divisors of m (the proof is easy). - _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Jun 06 2005
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..57
author: Vasiliy Danilov (danilovv(AT)usa.net) Jun 15 1998
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 09 2000
